lesson.title: The Paper In Paper Money
lesson.sentence: You can fold paper money and write on it and draw on it, too. Paper money seems to be like the notebook paper you use in school. But it’s not the same. Notebook paper, like most other kinds of paper, is made of wood fibers from trees. Fibers are parts of wood that are shaped like long, thin threads. Paper money is made from cotton and linen plants. They are pounded together to form strong fibers. Those fibers hold together firmly. So, money is stronger than notebook paper. People use linen and cotton paper to make money so that it will last longer. This way, people don’t have to make a lot of new money all the time. Also, it is harder for someone to make fake money because it is hard to find paper made from linen and cotton. In fact, the company that makes the paper for our money doesn’t make paper for anyone else!
